tags.name: layout
tags.description: | all-in-one declarative interface (set [PUT] & read [GET] over JSON)

tags.name: actions
tags.description: | execution of some form of computation (RPC over JSON)

parameters.name: predicate
parameters.description: Composed query parameters used for filtering. 'id' parameter can be used for all objects. Other parameters are present according to object type (title, description,...). You can specify any object parameter and parameter of related entity up to 2nd level (for example name=John&language=english,czech&address.city=London&father.id=123).

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Filtering parameter in RSQL. See https://github.com/jirutka/rsql-parser. You can specify any object parameter and parameter of related entity (for example title=='Some Title';description=='desc'). Additionally, if the entity relationship represents a polymorphic entity type, it can be casted to its subtypes (for example relatedEntity::subtype.subtypeProperty=='Value 123').

parameters.name: predicate

You can specify any object parameter and parameter of related entity (for example title=='Some Title';description=='desc'). Additionally, if the entity relationship represents a polymorphic entity type, it can be casted to its subtypes (for example relatedEntity::subtype.subtypeProperty=='Value 123').

parameters.name: predicate
parameters.description: Composed query parameters used for filtering. 'id' parameter can be used for all objects. Other parameters are present according to object type (title, description,...). You can specify any object parameter and parameter of related entity up to 2nd level (for example name=John&language=english,czech&address.city=London&father.id=123).

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Filtering parameter in RSQL. See https://github.com/jirutka/rsql-parser. You can specify any object parameter and parameter of related entity (for example title=='Some Title';description=='desc'). Additionally, if the entity relationship represents a polymorphic entity type, it can be casted to its subtypes (for example relatedEntity::subtype.subtypeProperty=='Value 123').

parameters.name: include
parameters.description:
Array of included collections or individual relationships. Includes are separated by commas (e.g. include=entity1s,entity2s). Collection include represents the inclusion of every relationship between this entity and the given collection. Relationship include represents the inclusion of the particular relationships only. If single parameter "ALL" is present, all possible includes are used (include=ALL).

__WARNING:__ Individual include types (collection, relationship or ALL) cannot be combined together.

Additionally, if the entity relationship represents a polymorphic entity type, it can be casted to its subtypes (for example relatedEntity::subtype.subtypeProperty=='Value 123').

parameters.name: include
parameters.description:
Array of included collections or individual relationships. Includes are separated by commas (e.g. include=entity1s,entity2s). Collection include represents the inclusion of every relationship between this entity and the given collection. Relationship include represents the inclusion of the particular relationships only. If single parameter "ALL" is present, all possible includes are used (include=ALL).

__WARNING:__ Individual include types (collection, relationship or ALL) cannot be combined together.

parameters.name: predicate
parameters.description: Composed query parameters used for filtering. 'id' parameter can be used for all objects. Other parameters are present according to object type (title, description,...). You can specify any object parameter and parameter of related entity up to 2nd level (for example name=John&language=english,czech&address.city=London&father.id=123).

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Filtering parameter in RSQL. See https://github.com/jirutka/rsql-parser. You can specify any object parameter and parameter of related entity (for example title=='Some Title';description=='desc'). Additionally, if the entity relationship represents a polymorphic entity type, it can be casted to its subtypes (for example relatedEntity::subtype.subtypeProperty=='Value 123').

parameters.description: Composed query parameters used for filtering. 'id' parameter can be used for all objects. Other parameters are present according to object type (title, description,...). You can specify any object parameter and parameter of related entity up to 2nd level (for example name=John&language=english,czech&address.city=London&father.id=123).

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Filtering parameter in RSQL. See https://github.com/jirutka/rsql-parser. You can specify any object parameter and parameter of related entity (for example title=='Some Title';description=='desc'). Additionally, if the entity relationship represents a polymorphic entity type, it can be casted to its subtypes (for example relatedEntity::subtype.subtypeProperty=='Value 123').

get.description: Gets complete layout of workspaces, their hierarchy, models.

put.description: Sets complete layout of workspaces, their hierarchy, models.

get.description: Retrieve current model of the workspace in declarative form.

put.description: Set complete layout of workspace, like model, authorization, etc.

204.description: The model of the workspace was set.

get.description: Retrieve current logical model of the workspace in declarative form.

put.description: Set effective logical model of the workspace.

get.description: Retrieve current analytics model of the workspace.

get.summary: Get workspace data filters for all workspaces
get.description: Retrieve all workspaces and related workspace data filters (and their settings / values).

put.description: Sets workspace data filters in all workspaces in entire organization.

get.description: Retrieve all users including authentication properties.

put.description: Set all users and their authentication properties.

get.summary: Get all users and user groups
get.description: Retrieve all users and user groups with theirs properties.

200.description: Retrieved all users and user groups.

put.summary: Put all users and user groups
put.description: Define all users and user groups with theirs properties.

200.description: Defined all users and user groups.

get.description: Retrieve all user-groups eventually with parent group.

put.description: Define all user groups with their parents eventually.

get.description: Retrieve complete layout of organization, workspaces, user-groups, etc.

200.description: Retrieved all parts of an organization.

put.description: Sets complete layout of organization, like workspaces, user-groups, etc.

201.description: Defined all parts of an organization.

get.description: Retrieve all data sources including related physical model.

put.description: Set all data sources including related physical model.

get.summary: Get data source physical model layout
get.description: Retrieve complete layout of tables with their columns

200.description: Retrieved data source physical mode layout.

204.description: Data source physical mode layout set successfully.

post.description: Notification sets up all reports to be computed again with new data.

404.description: Data source with given name does not exist.

404.description: Data source with given name does not exist.

DataSourceTableIdentifier.description: An id of the table from PDM mapped to this dataset. Including ID of data source.

description.example: Period to period comparison of revenues in main sectors.

analyticalDashboards.description: A list of analytical dashboards available in the model.

filterContexts.description: A list of filter contexts available in the model.

metrics.description: A list of metrics available in the model.

visualizationObjects.description: A list of visualization objects available in the model.

dashboardPlugins.description: A list of dashboard plugins available in the model.

description.example: Customer name including first and last name.

id.description: The Dataset ID. This ID is further used to refer to this instance of dataset.

DeclarativeDataset.description: A dataset defined by its properties.

granularities.description: An array of date granularities. All listed granularities will be available for date dataset.

description.example: A number of orders created by the customer - including all orders, even the non-delivered ones.

sourceColumn.description: A name of the source column in the table.

primary.description: A flag indicating whether the label should be treated as a primary one.

sourceColumn.description: A name of the source column in the table.

description.example: Sales for all the data available.

multivalue.description: The multi-value flag enables many-to-many cardinality for references.

sourceColumns.description: An array of source column names for a given reference.

description.example: Simple number for total goods in current production.

name.description: Name of a workspace to view.

DeclarativeWorkspace.description: A declarative form of a particular workspace.

id.description: Workspace Data Filters ID. This ID is further used to refer to this instance.

columnName.description: Workspace Data Filters column name. Data are filtered using this physical column.

workspaceDataFilterSettings.description: Filter settings specifying values of filters valid for the workspace.

DeclarativeWorkspaceDataFilter.description: Workspace Data Filters serving the filtering of what data users can see in workspaces.

id.description: Workspace Data Filters ID. This ID is further used to refer to this instance.

filterValues.description: Only those rows are returned, where columnName from filter matches those values.

items.description: Only those rows are returned, where columnName from filter matches those values.

DeclarativeWorkspaceDataFilterSetting.description: Workspace Data Filters serving the filtering of what data users can see in workspaces.

DeclarativeWorkspaceModel.description: A declarative form of a model and analytics for a workspace.

DeclarativeWorkspaces.description: A declarative form of a all workspace layout.

titleBase.description: Title base is used as a token in title pattern. If left empty, it is replaced by date dataset title.

titlePattern.description:
This pattern is used to generate the title of attributes and labels that result from the granularities.
There are two tokens available: 
* `%titleBase` - represents shared part by all titles, or title of Date Dataset if left empty
* `%granularityTitle` - represents `DateGranularity` built-in title

GranularitiesFormatting.description: A date dataset granularities title formatting rules.

JsonNode.description: A server agnostic definition of the dashboard plugin in JSON format.

DeclarativeModel.description: A data model structured as a set of its attributes.

DeclarativeAnalytics.description: Entities describing users' view on data.

authId.description: User identification in the authentication manager.

DeclarativeUsers.description: Declarative form of users and its properties.

DeclarativeUsersUserGroups.description: Declarative form of both users and user groups and theirs properties.

DeclarativeUserGroups.description: Declarative form of userGroups and its properties.

isPrimaryKey.description: Is column part of primary key?

url.description: An connection string relevant to type of database.

username.description: User with permission connect the data source/database.

password.description: Password for the data-source user, property is never returned back.

token.description: Token as an alternative to username and password.
token.example: Bigquery service account JSON. Encode it using base64!

cachePath.description: Path to schema, where intermediate caches are stored.

DeclarativeDataSource.description: A data source and its properties.

DeclarativeOrganization.description: Complete definition of an organization in a declarative form.

oauthClientSecret.description: Communication secret of the authentication provider (never returned back).

tables.description: An array of physical database tables.

DeclarativeDataSources.description: A data source and its properties.

DeclarativePdm.description: A physical data model (PDM) representation for single data source.

separator.description: A separator between prefixes and the names. Default is "__".

tablePrefix.description: Tables starting with this prefix will be included. The prefix is then followed by the value of `separator` parameter. Given the table prefix is `out_table` and separator is `__`, the table with name like `out_table__customers` will be scanned.

viewPrefix.description: Views starting with this prefix will be included. The prefix is then followed by the value of `separator` parameter. Given the view prefix is `out_view` and separator is `__`, the table with name like `out_view__us_customers` will be scanned.

primaryLabelPrefix.description: Columns starting with this prefix will be considered as primary labels. The prefix is then followed by the value of `separator` parameter. Given the primary label prefix is `pl` and separator is `__`, the columns with name like `pl__country_id` will be considered as primary labels.

secondaryLabelPrefix.description: Columns starting with this prefix will be considered as secondary labels. The prefix is then followed by the value of `separator` parameter. Given the secondary label prefix is `sl` and separator is `__`, the columns with name like `sl__country_id_country_name` will be considered as secondary labels.

factPrefix.description: Columns starting with this prefix will be considered as facts. The prefix is then followed by the value of `separator` parameter. Given the fact prefix is `f` and separator is `__`, the columns with name like `f__sold` will be considered as facts.

dateGranularities.description: Option to control date granularities for date datasets. Empty value enables common date granularities (DAY, WEEK, MONTH, QUARTER, YEAR). Default value is `all` which enables all available date granularities, including time granularities (like hours, minutes).

grainPrefix.description: Columns starting with this prefix will be considered as grains. The prefix is then followed by the value of `separator` parameter. Given the grain prefix is `g` and separator is `__`, the columns with name like `g__name` will be considered as grains.

referencePrefix.description: Columns starting with this prefix will be considered as references. The prefix is then followed by the value of `separator` parameter. Given the reference prefix is `r` and separator is `__`, the columns with name like `r__customer_name` will be considered as references.

grainReferencePrefix.description: Columns starting with this prefix will be considered as grain references. The prefix is then followed by the value of `separator` parameter. Given the reference prefix is `gr` and separator is `__`, the columns with name like `gr__customer_name` will be considered as grain references.

denormPrefix.description: Columns starting with this prefix will be considered as denormalization references. The prefix is then followed by the value of `separator` parameter. Given the denormalization reference prefix is `dr` and separator is `__`, the columns with name like `dr__customer_name` will be considered as denormalization references.

wdfPrefix.description: Column serving as workspace data filter. No labels are auto generated for such columns.

GenerateLdmRequest.description: A request containing all information needed for generation of logical model.

size.name: size
size.description: The size of the page to be returned

sort.name: sort
sort.description: Sorting criteria in the format: property(,asc|desc). Default sort order is ascending. Multiple sort criteria are supported.
